intro: Epilobium nanhualpinum, commonly known as the alpine willow or narrow-leaved willow, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, usually pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Epilobium nanhualpinum is adapted to cold climates and is often used in traditional medicine in its native regions.
